result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen Vernon Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: TOTAL AMOUNT: $0.00
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

08:40 Defendant Glen Vernon Wood in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie files an amended information. Thorie: plea to 3 charges in information (count 1 was amended to misd. battery counts 2 and 3 remain the same), S/W for 2 years conditions of probation--restitution, compliance with AODA assessment, Thorie requests court to consider no contact with victim. Atty Loberg and defendant agree.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to all 3 counts in the amended information.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEAS, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the 3 counts in the amended information. Thorie also requests 30 days for the State to request restitutions.  Atty Loberg addresses the court, requests a possible restitution hearing when filed by the State. Defendant addresses the court. Court orders: S/W 2 years on the 3 counts concurrent, conditions of probation:  restitution, Thorie has 30 days to submit claim, Atty Loberg then has 5 days to respond, AODA assessment and compliance with recommendations, no contact with Bobbi Jo Jolliff, court costs count 1 DNA Sample and Surcharge $443.00, Counts 2 and 3 court costs: $243 on each count.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 09:01

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant  Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.  Defendant enters not guilty plea to Counts 1, 2 and 3 at preliminary hearing.  Not guilty plea received by the court.  The bond will continue as ordered.  Bond conditions reviewed with defendant.  Pretrial Conference to be set.

2:20 p.m.  Defendant Glen Vernon Wood in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
